article_title: U.S. Losing Money on Sugar Loan Program
article_text:
There is no way to sugarcoat it: The U.S. government is being forced to support sugar companies even though taxpayers are already footing a $280 million bill stemming from loans the companies can't repay.

The loans are part of a U.S. Department of Agriculture program aimed at supporting sugar prices. When sugar prices are high, processors—companies that turn raw beet and cane into sugar—pay the agency back on time and the program...
